review_blob: Bottle, 0.33l. Clear golden colour with medium creamy white head. Average carbonation. Smells like lager. Taste is medium sweet with hints of fruit with herbal aftertaste. Overall not so good.

Bottle, 0.33l. Hazy golden colour with big, creamy white head. Average carbonation. Hoppy, citrus aroma. Taste starts a bit sweet and citrusy followed by strong hoppy bitterness. Overall very refreshing, excellent brew.

Bottle, 0,33l. Almost black colour with big, creamy, beige head. Medium carbonation. Fruity and roasty aroma with hints of chocolate. Strong hoppy taste, followed by bitter chocolate. Overall good beer.

Bottle, 0.33l. Dark brown colour with thin beige head. Average carbonation. Fruity, sweet aroma. Taste is bitter sweet with some sourness in the aftertaste. Alcohol is well hidden. Overall great beer.
Bottle, 0.33l- Deep black colour with minimal beige head. Medium carbonation. Coffee and caramel aroma. Taste of roasted malts and coffee with bitter-sweet aftertaste. Nice label. Overall not bad.
Bottle, 0.33l. Cloudy amber colour with minimal white head. Low carbonation. Fruity aroma. Taste is hoppy, citrusy with strong bitter aftertaste. Overall nice beer.
Bottle, 0.33l. Hazy amber colour with small beige head. Medium carbonation. Fruity, hoppy aroma. Taste is mild sweet, fruity with moderate bitter aftertaste. Overall good brew.

Bottle, 0.33l. Clear amber colour with medium, frothy, white head. Medium carbonation. Fruity, hoppy aroma. Citrus, fruity, hoppy taste with medium sweet aftertaste. Overall good, but a bit too sweet for an IPA.
Bottle, 0.5 l. Pale yellow colour with nice white head. Average carbonation. Hoppy, yeasty aroma. Taste is moderate bitter with some herbal note. Overall average beer.
Bottle, 0.33l. Clear golden colour with nice white head. Average carbonation. Typical pale lager aroma and taste. Overall nothing to remember.

Bottle, 0.33l. Cloudy orange colour with nice white head. Average carbonation. Fruity, herbal aroma. Taste is fruity with some herbal notes and moderate bitter aftertaste. Overall very good beer with nice label. Another good one from this brewery.

Bottle, 0.33l. Cloudy orange colour with large white head. Average carbonation. Hoppy, citrus aroma. Taste is fruity with strong bitter aftertaste. Overall excellent. Another great beer from this brewery.
Bottle, 0.5l. Clear, pale golden colour with small white head. Average carbonation. Sweet and yeasty aroma. Taste is bitter-swet with some spicy notes. Overall good beer.

Bottle, 0.33l. Hazy, amber colour with thin beige head which leaves some lacing. Average carbonation. Strong hoppy aroma with notes of pine and fruits. Intense hop flavor with strong and long lasting bitter aftertaste. Overall excellent beer.
beer_name: Mali Grad The Girl from Ipanema

review_blob: Bottle, 0.5l. Clear copper colour with small, foamy, white head. Average carbonation.Taste and aroma are sweet and mild fruity. Overall nothing to remember.
beer_name: Shepherd Neame Whitstable Bay Organic Ale (Bottle)

review_blob: Bottle, 0.33l. Dark brown colour with medium, creamy, beige head. Soft carbonation. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and citrus. Taste starts light sweet and finishes with strong bitter aftertaste. You can not feel any alcohol even though it is quite strong beer. Overal really good beer.

Bottle, 0.5l. Clear almost black colour with creamy, beige, long lasting head. Low carbonation. Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate and coffee. Taste follows the aroma. Bittersweet aftertaste.Overall smooth, decent stout.
Bottle, 0.33l. Clear red-brown colour with medium beige head. Medium carbonation. Malty aroma. Taste starts sweet with nice herbal and moderate bitter aftertaste. Overall good beer.

Bottle, 0.33l. Clear amber colour with small beige head. Low carbonation. Aroma of fruit, caramel and alcohol. Taste is fruity and too sweet with medium bitterness. Overall too strong and sweet. Not my kind of beer.
Bottle, 0.33l. Clear golden colour wit medium an short lasting white head. Lively carbonation. Spicy aroma. Sweet, spicy and yeasty taste with medium bitternes. Overall decent bber.

On tap at Sir Williams, Ljubljana. Clear golden orange colour with medium sized, creamy white head. Lively carbonation. Fruity aroma. Taste starts a bit sweet, followed by pleasant hoppy bitternes. Nice bitter aftertaste. Overall good beer.

Bottle, 0.5l. Had this and some other fruit-flavoured beers during my trip in Iran years ago. Clear yellow colour with minimal white head. Strong carbonation. Fruity, sweet aroma. Taste is sweet, fruity with no bitterness.Overall not a stunning beer experience but since you cant buy a real beer in Iran (legally:) its a good alternative to juices. At least the bottle looks like a real beer bottle.

Bottle, 0.33l. Clear, black colour with big, lasting beige head and nice lacing. Low carbonation. Aroma of roasted malts, coffe and liquorice. Taste follows the aroma with hints of dark chocolate and hops. Overall great beer.
Bottle, 0.33l. Hazy, yellow colour with big white head. Average carbonation. Sweet, yeasty, citrusy aroma. Sweet and bitter taste. Overall interesting beer.

Bottle, 0.5l. Clear amber colour with medium white head. Medium carbonation. Sweet malty aroma. Taste is is malty and fruity with light notes of caramel. Some bitterness in the aftertaste. Overall very average.

Bottle, 0.33l. Clear, almost black colour with big, creamy, beige head. Medium carbonation. Aroma of dark malts, fruit, caramel and chocolate. Complex taste follows the aroma. Some smoke in the aftertaste. Overall very delicious beer.

Bottle, 0.5l. Clear orange-golden color with large and lasting beige head which leaves nice lacing. Soft carbonation. Fruity aroma with notes of pine. Mild sweetnes at the start then the bitterness covers almost everything else. Overall drinkable but not the best IPA Ive tried.

Bottle, 0,33 l. Clear golden colour with small white head. Nice lacing. Average carbonation. Aroma is fruity, citrusy. Taste is citrusy and hoppy with nice bitter aftertaste. Overall drinkable and enjoyable IPA.
Bottle, 0.5l. Clear amber colour with nice white head which vanishes in seconds. Average carbonation. Sweet, fruity aroma. taste follows the aroma. Nice bitter aftertaste. Overall average beer.

Bottle, 0.33l. Clear golden colour with minimal white head. Lively carbonation. Herbal aroma. Taste is moderate sweet with hint of honey. Low bitterness. I couldnt really smell or taste the buckwheat. Overall not something I would like to order again.

Bottle, 0.5l. Clear ruby colour with minimal white head. Low carbonation. Sweet caramel aroma. Taste of sweet caramel with hints of fruit. Quite sweet with mild bitterness in the aftertaste. Overall good beer but nothing special.

Bottle, 0.5l. Dark brown-black colour topped with big, beige, creamy head which almost disappears in a minute but leaves some lacing on the glass. Low carbonation. Aroma or roasted malt and coffee. Taste of coffee, caramel with hints of chocolate. Lightly sweet with moderate bitterness in the aftertaste. Overall nice, smooth stout.

Bottle, 0.5l. Clear yellow-golden colour with minimal white head. Average carbonation. Aroma of malt and grain. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Overall typical macro lager. Rated by memory, drank it in beautiful old town pub in Tbilisi, Georgia years ago. I remembered it because Natakhtari is the now the official sponsor of Georgian basketball team in Euro 2015:)
Bottle, 0.33l. Hazy amber colour with minimal creamy, beige head. Medium carbonation. Aroma of fruit, pine and malt. Taste follows the aroma. Overall nice beer.
Bottle, 0,35l. Clear golden-orange colour with white head. Medium carbonation. Hoppy aroma with citrus and pine. Herbal-fruity bitterness in the aftertaste. Overall good and refreshing brew.
Bottle 0,5l. Golden hazy yellow colour with big white head. Medium carbonation. Aroma of banana, wheat and yeast. Taste follows the aroma. Mild bitter finish. Overall nice, refreshing beer.

Bottle, 0,33l. Dark brown color with a medium creamy beige head. Light carbonation. Aroma of coffee, roasted malt and notes of licorice. Taste is lightly sweet at the beginning wild mild bitterness and sourness at the end. Overall good stout.
Bottle, 0.5l. Clear yellow colour with big frothy head which dissapers in seconds.Taste is light sweet to moderate bitter. Overall nothing to remember, another macro lager.

Bottle, 0.5l. Hazy light brown colour with medium white head. Light carbonation. Cirus and pine aroma.Taste is sweet at the beginning and finishes with medium bitterness. Overall nice, refreshing IPA.
Bottle, 0.5l. Hazy orange colour with lasting, creamy white head. Medium carbonation. Fruity aroma. Taste is sweet, citrus, fruity with gentle bitter finish. Overall very good beer with nice label.

Bottle, 0.33l. Clear light orange color with big, frothy white head which leaves nice lacing on the pint glass. Lively carbonation. Fruity and citrus aroma. Taste is mild sweet followed by some herbs and strong bitterness. Overall delicious beer.

Bottle, 0.33 l. Hazy orange color with medium sized tan head. Low carbonation. Aroma of citrus and tropical fruits. Fruity, citrus taste with strong bitter aftertaste. Overall very good, refreshing beer.
Bottle, 0,5l. Clear pale yellow colour with thin white head. Average carbonation. Aroma of corn and grain. Light sweet taste with minimal bitterness. Overall standard pale lager.

Tap at Karavana domaih pivovarn in Novo mesto. Hazy amber color with small, creamy, long lasting head. Soft carbonation. Fruity aroma. Taste is sweet and fruity at the beginning with nice bitter aftertaste. Overall good beer.

On tap at Karavana domaih pivovarjev in Novo mesto. Hazy dark orange colour with medium, creamy, long lasting white head. Minimal carbonation. Great fruity and herbal aroma. Taste follows the aroma, finish is moderate bitter. Overall very tasty beer.

On tap at Sir Williams, Ljubljana. Clear amber color with small white head which leaves some lacing. Soft carbonation. Aroma of citrus, caramel and pine. Taste of fruits, caramel and herbs. Starts sweet-sour with moderate bitter and herbal aftertaste. Overall nice IPA named after general and poet who was born in my hometown.
Bottle, 0.5l. Clear golden colour with thin white head. Average carbonation. Taste is bitter sweet. Overall average macro lager.

beer_brewer_name: Bernard Family Brewery / Rodinn pivovar Bernard
review_blob: Bottle, 0.5l. Clear dark amber colour with medium beige head. Average carbonation. Caramel and malty aroma. Taste follows the aroma, bitter sweet with touch of sourness in the aftertaste. Overall quite good.

Bottle, 0.33l. Clear, dark red-brown colour with big frothy, beige head. Average carbonation. Taste starts light sweet, followed by strong, artificial sour cherry taste. A touch of bitterness in the aftertaste. I couldnt taste or smell the chestnut. Overall not my kind of beer but anyway congratulations to Lako for trying something new.
Bottle, 0.5l. Clear golden colour with medium creamy, white head. Average carbonation. Sweet, malty aroma with notes of hops.Taste is malty with medium bitterness. Overall good pilsener.
